alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 01 at 3:02AM MDT until November 03 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to Midnight MDT Wednesday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will begin over the Continental Divide by Tuesday afternoon and develop along the east side of Glacier National Park by evening. North winds and falling temperatures Tuesday night could lead to rapidly deteriorating conditions along Highway 89 from Kiowa north to the Canadian border, where snow may be heavy at times late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
